name: sfpwowerscript-triggerapextest-task
friendlyName: Trigger Apex Test in an Org
description: Triggers an asynchronous apex unit  test in an org, This task is part of DX@Scale/SFPowerscripts
author: dxatscale@accenture.com

inputs.name: target_org
inputs.label: Alias or username of the target org
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path in the current working directory containing  config file for the scratch org

inputs.name: testlevel
inputs.label: Test Level
inputs.helpMarkDown: The test level of the test that need to be executed when the code is to be deployed

inputs.name: specified_tests
inputs.label: Tests to be executed
inputs.helpMarkDown: comma-separated list of Apex test class names or IDs and, if applicable, test methods to run

inputs.name: apextestsuite
inputs.label: Apex Test Suite
inputs.helpMarkDown: comma-separated list of Apex test suite names to run

inputs.name: package
inputs.label: Package Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify name of package to run tests for

inputs.name: synchronous
inputs.label: Run tests from a single class synchronously
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an option if the tests are to be run synchronously

inputs.name: validateIndividualClassCoverage
inputs.label: Validate code coverage of individual classes
inputs.helpMarkDown: Validates indvidual classes meet the minimum required percentage coverage

inputs.name: validatePackageCoverage
inputs.label: Validate code coverage of package
inputs.helpMarkDown: Validates whether package coverage is greater than the minimum required percentage coverage

inputs.name: coverageThreshold
inputs.label: Minimum required percentage coverage
inputs.helpMarkDown: Minimum required percentage coverage, when validating code coverage

inputs.name: project_directory
inputs.label: Project Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The project directory should contain a sfdx-project.json

inputs.name: wait_time
inputs.label: Wait Time
inputs.helpMarkDown: wait time for command to finish in minutes
